list.name: Melissa
list.about: In Rick and Morty, there is no specific character named Melissa. However, the show is known for its multiverse concept, where different versions of characters exist in alternate dimensions. So, it's possible that there could be a Melissa in some other dimension!

list.name: Michael Denny and the Denny Singers
list.about: Michael Denny and the Denny Singers is a fictional band mentioned in the episode 'Rixty Minutes' of Rick and Morty. They are known for their hit song 'Goodbye Moonmen,' which is a catchy and surreal tune that plays during an interdimensional TV broadcast.

list.name: Michael Jenkins
list.about: Michael Jenkins is a minor character in Rick and Morty. He is known for his short appearance in the episode 'Raising Gazorpazorp,' where he gets attacked by a Gazorpian. Despite his limited screen time, his unfortunate encounter adds to the chaotic nature of the show.

list.name: Michael McLick
list.about: Michael McLick is a character from the episode 'Meeseeks and Destroy' in Rick and Morty. He is an accomplished photographer whose photographs reveal embarrassing secrets of people. However, his skills come at a cost, as he suffers from a severe case of 'shutter addiction.'

list.name: Michael Thompson
list.about: Michael Thompson is a character who has not appeared in Rick and Morty. However, the show often introduces new characters, both major and minor, in each episode. So, there's always a possibility that Michael Thompson might make an appearance in a future episode!

list.name: Million Ants
list.about: Million Ants is a superhero character introduced in the episode 'Vindicators 3: The Return of Worldender' in Rick and Morty. As his name suggests, he is composed of millions of sentient ants working together. Despite his unique powers, he faces personal struggles and has a complex backstory.

list.name: Mitch
list.about: Mitch is a character from the episode 'Total Rickall' in Rick and Morty. He is an alien parasite that infiltrates memories, creating false ones. Mitch disguises himself as a close family friend, but he is eventually exposed and eliminated by the Smith family.

list.name: Mohawk Guy
list.about: Mohawk Guy, also known as Roger, is a character who appears in the episode 'Close Rick-Counters of the Rick Kind.' He is a member of the Council of Ricks, an assembly of alternate reality versions of Rick Sanchez. Mohawk Guy is known for his distinctive hairstyle and rebellious attitude.

list.name: Morty Mart Manager Morty
list.about: Morty Mart Manager Morty is a character from the episode 'Rickmancing the Stone' in Rick and Morty. In a post-apocalyptic dimension, he manages a store called Morty Mart. Despite his managerial role, he is not particularly skilled or confident, leading to various comedic situations.

list.name: Morty Jr.
list.about: Morty Jr. is the offspring of Morty Smith and his pet gazorpians from the episode 'Raising Gazorpazorp.' He quickly grows into a full-grown adult due to his alien genetics. Morty Jr. goes through an existential crisis, struggling to find his place in a world he doesn't fully understand.

list.name: Morty Rick
list.about: Morty Rick is not a specific character in Rick and Morty. However, the series often features alternate versions of characters from different dimensions. So, there's a chance that there could be a Morty Rick in some alternate reality where Morty takes on Rick's role as the genius scientist.

list.name: Morty Smith
list.about: Morty Smith is one of the main characters in Rick and Morty. He is a timid and easily influenced teenager who often gets dragged into his grandfather Rick's interdimensional adventures. Over the course of the series, Morty grows more assertive and develops a complex relationship with Rick.

list.name: Morty K-22
list.about: Morty K-22 is not a known character from Rick and Morty. However, the show frequently explores different versions of characters in alternate dimensions. So, it's possible that Morty K-22 could exist in a separate reality with unique characteristics and adventures.

list.name: Morty Smith
list.about: Morty Smith is one of the main characters in Rick and Morty. He is a timid and easily influenced teenager who often gets dragged into his grandfather Rick's interdimensional adventures. Over the course of the series, Morty grows more assertive and develops a complex relationship with Rick.

list.name: Mortytown Loco
list.about: Mortytown Loco is a character who appears in the episode 'The Ricklantis Mixup,' also known as 'Tales from the Citadel.' He is a member of the Mortytown Locos gang, which is involved in criminal activities in the Citadel of Ricks. Mortytown Loco represents the darker and grittier side of Morty's character possibilities.

list.name: Mr. Beauregard
list.about: Mr. Beauregard is a character who appears in the episode 'Rest and Ricklaxation.' He is a friendly and polite version of Jerry Smith, Morty's father. Mr. Beauregard becomes involved in a romantic relationship with Rick's toxic side, leading to comedic and dramatic situations.

list.name: Mr. Benson
list.about: Mr. Benson is a character who appears in the episode 'Close Rick-Counters of the Rick Kind.' He is a high-ranking member of the Council of Ricks and is known for his distinctive facial hair and appearance. Mr. Benson plays a minor role in the overall plot of the episode.

list.name: Mr. Booby Buyer
list.about: Mr. Booby Buyer is a character from the episode 'Interdimensional Cable 2: Tempting Fate' in Rick and Morty. He is a recurring character in the interdimensional TV segments, where he is shown buying various types of booby-related products. His exaggerated personality adds to the absurd humor of the show.

list.name: Mr. Goldenfold
list.about: Mr. Goldenfold is a character who serves as a teacher at Harry Herpson High School in Rick and Morty. He often finds himself involved in Rick and Morty's adventures, either through his own choices or by getting caught up in the chaos. Despite being a side character, Mr. Goldenfold has his share of interesting and humorous moments.
